intro: Eriogonum grangerense, commonly known as Granger's buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in sagebrush steppe and desert scrub habitats. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a rough texture, while its stems are woody at the base. Eriogonum grangerense is adapted to arid environments and plays a role in supporting local pollinators and wildlife.
